name: Zone
overview:
This class allows you interact with Cloud DNS.

google-cloud is deprecated

Due to the scope of our API rapidly increasing, you may notice a decrease in performance if you continue to use the bundled module, `google-cloud`.

Going forward, please install only the individual service modules that you need, such as google-cloud.

The instructions below are here for reference, however, we will soon stop releasing updates to the bundled package.

First, install google-cloud with npm:

$ npm install --save google-cloud

If you are running your app on Google Compute Engine, you won't need to worry about supplying connection configuration options to google-cloudâ€” we figure that out for you.

However, if you're running your app elsewhere, you will need to provide project details to authenticate API requests.

Google Cloud Platform

var gcloud = require('google-cloud'); var dns = gcloud.dns();

Elsewhere

var gcloud = require('google-cloud'); var dns = gcloud.dns({ projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123', keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json' });

The full set of options which can be passed to google-cloud are outlined in our Authentication guide.

methods.name: Zone
methods.description: A Zone object is used to interact with your project's managed zone. It will help you add or delete records, delete your zone, and many other convenience methods.

examples.code: var zone = dns.zone('zone-id');

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

examples.code: zone.exists(function(err, exists) {});

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: get
methods.description:
Get a zone if it exists.

You may optionally use this to "get or create" an object by providing an object with autoCreate set to true. Any extra configuration that is normally required for the create method must be contained within this object as well.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: options.autoCreate
params.description: • Automatically create the object if it does not exist. Default: false

examples.code: zone.getMetadata(function(err, metadata, apiResponse) {});

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: callback.metadata
params.description: • Metadata of the zone from the API.

methods.name: addRecords
methods.description: Add records to this zone. This is a convenience wrapper around dns/zone#createChange.

methods.name: change
methods.description: Create a reference to a change object in this zone.

examples.code: var change = zone.change('change-id');

methods.name: createChange
methods.description: Create a change of resource record sets for the zone.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: config.add
params.description: • Record objects to add to this zone.

params.name: config.delete
params.description: • Record objects to delete from this zone. Be aware that the resource records here must match exactly to be deleted.

methods.name: delete
methods.description:
Delete the zone.

Only empty zones can be deleted. Set options.force to true to call dns/zone#empty before deleting the zone. Two API calls will then be made (one to empty, another to delete), which means this is not an atomic request.

examples.caption: Use force to first empty the zone before deleting it.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

methods.name: deleteRecords
methods.description:
Delete records from this zone. This is a convenience wrapper around dns/zone#createChange.

This method accepts dns/record objects or string record types in its place. This means that you can delete all A records or NS records, etc. If used this way, two API requests are made (one to get, then another to delete), which means the operation is not atomic and could result in unexpected changes.

examples.caption: Delete multiple records at once.
Possibly a simpler way to perform the above change is deleting records by type.
examples.code: zone.deleteRecords('ns', callback);

examples.caption: You can also delete records of multiple types.
examples.code: zone.deleteRecords(['ns', 'a'], callback);

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: record
params.description: • If given a string, it is interpreted as a record type. All records that match that type will be retrieved and then deleted. You can also provide a dns/record object or array of objects.

methods.name: empty
methods.description: Emptying your zone means leaving only 'NS' and 'SOA' records. This method will first fetch the non-NS and non-SOA records from your zone using dns/zone#getRecords, then use dns/zone#createChange to create a deletion change.

methods.name: export
methods.description: Provide a path to a zone file to copy records into the zone.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.
examples.code: zone.export(zoneFilename).then(function() {});

params.name: localPath
params.description: • The fully qualified path to the zone file.

methods.name: getChanges
methods.description: Get the list of changes associated with this zone. A change is an atomic update to a collection of records.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: query.maxApiCalls
params.description: • Maximum number of API calls to make.

params.name: query.sort
params.description: • Set to 'asc' for ascending, and 'desc' for descending or omit for no sorting.

methods.name: getChangesStream
methods.description: Get the list of dns/change objects associated with this zone as a readable object stream.

examples.caption: If you anticipate many results, you can end a stream early to prevent unnecessary processing and API requests.

params.name: query
params.description: • Configuration object. See dns/zone#getChanges for a complete list of options.

methods.name: getRecords
methods.description: Get the list of records for this zone.

examples.caption: Provide a query for further customization.
If you only want records of a specific type or types, provide them in place of the query object.
You can also specify multiple record types.
If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: query.maxApiCalls
params.description: • Maximum number of API calls to make.

params.name: query.maxResults
params.description: • Maximum number of results to be returned.

params.name: query.name
params.description: • Restricts the list to return only records with this fully qualified domain name.

params.name: query.type
params.description: • Restricts the list to return only records of this type. If present, the "name" parameter must also be present.

methods.name: getRecordsStream
methods.description: Get the list of dns/record objects for this zone as a readable object stream.

examples.caption: If you anticipate many results, you can end a stream early to prevent unnecessary processing and API requests.

params.name: query
params.description: • Configuration object. See dns/zone#getRecords for a complete list of options.

methods.name: import
methods.description: Copy the records from a zone file into this zone.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.

params.name: localPath
params.description: • The fully qualified path to the zone file.

methods.name: record
methods.description:
A dns/record object can be used to construct a record you want to add to your zone, or to refer to an existing one.

Note that using this method will not itself make any API requests. You will use the object returned in other API calls, for example to add a record to your zone or to delete an existing one.

examples.caption: Reference an existing record to delete from your zone.
Construct a record to add to your zone.
Use these records together to create a change.

params.name: type
params.description: • The type of record to construct or the type of record you are referencing.

params.name: metadata.data
params.description: • Defined in RFC 1035, section 5 and RFC 1034, section 3.6.1.

params.name: metadata.ttl
params.description: • Seconds that the resource is cached by resolvers.

methods.name: replaceRecords
methods.description:
Provide a record type that should be deleted and replaced with other records.

This is not an atomic request. Two API requests are made (one to get records of the type that you've requested, then another to replace them), which means the operation is not atomic and could result in unexpected changes.

examples.caption: If the callback is omitted, we'll return a Promise.
